title: 103_s740
content: The Act titled "Expedited Consideration of Proposed Rescissions Act of 1993" amends the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974 to allow for expedited consideration of certain proposed rescissions. The "Expedited Consideration of Proposed Rescissions Act of 1993" allows the President to propose rescinding budget authority provided in an appropriations Act through a special message to Congress within 3 days of the Act's enactment. The proposed rescission can only be done once and cannot be repeated. The President can propose rescinding budget authority in an appropriations Act through a special message to Congress within 3 days of enactment. The special message must specify the budget authority to be rescinded and follow certain procedures for expedited consideration by Congress. The majority or minority leader of the House of Congress must introduce the draft bill or joint resolution accompanying the special message regarding rescinding budget authority. If not introduced, any Member of the House can do so after the third day of continuous session. The bill or joint resolution will be referred to the Committee on Appropriations without substantive revision and must be reported within seven days of receipt. The Committee on Appropriations must report the bill or joint resolution within seven days of receipt, or it will be automatically discharged. A vote on final passage must be taken within the 10th calendar day of continuous session after the bill's introduction.
